bug.author: raphael0202
bug.summary: KeyError during POS tagging using the French model
bug.description:
Related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/explosion/spaCy/issues/683>#683</denchmark-link>
Minimal example to reproduce the bug: <denchmark-code>In [1]: import spacy In [2]: nlp = spacy.load('fr') In [3]: nlp(" ") --------------------------------------------------------------------------- KeyError Traceback (most recent call last) <ipython-input-39-170215c766db> in <module>() ----> 1 nlp(" ")
/home/raphael/git_core/spaCy/spacy/language.py in __call__(self, text, tag, parse, entity) 327 for proc in self.pipeline: 328 if proc and not skip.get(proc): --> 329 proc(doc) 330 return doc 331
/home/raphael/git_core/spaCy/spacy/tagger.pyx in spacy.tagger.Tagger.__call__ (spacy/tagger.cpp:6245)()
/home/raphael/git_core/spaCy/spacy/morphology.pyx in spacy.morphology.Morphology.assign_tag_id (spacy/morphology.cpp:4681)()
KeyError: 139255` </denchmark-code>
The error comes from morphology.pyx (line 76): <denchmark-code> cdef int assign_tag_id(self, TokenC* token, int tag_id) except -1: if tag_id >= self.n_tags: raise ValueError("Unknown tag ID: %s" % tag_id) # TODO: It's pretty arbitrary to put this logic here. I guess the justification # is that this is where the specific word and the tag interact. Still, # we should have a better way to enforce this rule, or figure out why # the statistical model fails. # Related to Issue #220 if Lexeme.c_check_flag(token.lex, IS_SPACE): tag_id = self.reverse_index[self.strings['SP']] # <<<<<<<<<<<< </denchmark-code>
'SP' is not defined in the French tag map, so its ID is not in self.reverse_index, leading to the KeyError. Here is the associated morphology tag_map: <denchmark-code>In [43]: nlp.vocab.morphology.tag_map Out[43]: {'ADJ': {74: 82}, 'ADP': {74: 83}, 'ADV': {74: 84}, 'AUX': {74: 85}, 'CCONJ': {74: 87}, 'CONJ': {74: 86}, 'DET': {74: 88}, 'INTJ': {74: 89}, 'NOUN': {74: 90}, 'NUM': {74: 91}, 'PART': {74: 92}, 'PRON': {74: 93}, 'PROPN': {74: 94}, 'PUNCT': {74: 95}, 'SCONJ': {74: 96}, 'SYM': {74: 97}, 'VERB': {74: 98}, 'X': {74: 99}} </denchmark-code>
I added the following tag map to FrenchDefaults: <denchmark-code>TAG_MAP = { "SP": {POS: SPACE}, } </denchmark-code>
and got a core dumped with nlp('\n'): <denchmark-code>*** Error in `/home/raphael/.virtualenvs/spacy_dev/bin/python3': free(): invalid next size (fast): 0x00000000036b1aa0 *** ======= Backtrace: comments.comment:
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/raphael0202>@raphael0202</denchmark-link> for debug. Just to confirm that adding : <denchmark-code>TAG_MAP = { "SP": {POS: SPACE}, } </denchmark-code>
in following file : <denchmark-code>/spacy/language_data/tag_map.py </denchmark-code>
solve the problem. Again, thanks for spacy's contributors 👍
Trained a Hungarian PoS model and run into the same problem.

Having the same issue with the Spanish model: <denchmark-code>def test_spacy(): nlp = spacy.load('es_core_web_md') doc = nlp("""Hay alguno cosas que me hacemos una persona la única. La primera característica es que soy muy talentoso en los idiomas extraños. Para mí, aprender un idioma extranjera no es un tarea muy difícil. La otra característica que me único hace es que sea muy resuelto. Cuando yo era niño, y jugaba deportes, detestaba perder un juego. Al final, soy un hombre que tiene talentas en los idiomas extrajeros, y es muy resuelto.""") assert doc.is_parsed </denchmark-code>

I can confirm the KeyError originally reported in this issue. Looks like it is still around. In my experience, the error seems to appear whenever the model encounters a linebreak ("
"). If I feed a simple string, all works fine. If my string includes a linebreak ("
"), the KeyErrror appears. Similarly, if I load some text from a file and that file has linebreaks in it, the KeyError appears. If I split the text loaded from the file in lines on the linebreak ("
") and parse each line separatedly, there is no error. I assume I'm using version 1.8.2 of spacy (there doesn't seem to be a __version__ attribute so I'm not sure) on Ubuntu 17.04 and using files in UTF-8 with Linux-style linebreaks. <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "myspacy.py", line 96, in <module> run_spacy(textfolder, language, outfolder) File "myspacy.py", line 91, in run_spacy annotated = annotate_text(text, annotator) File "myspacy.py", line 48, in annotate_text annotated = annotator(text) File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/spacy/language.py", line 329, in __call__ proc(doc) File "spacy/tagger.pyx", line 212, in spacy.tagger.Tagger.__call__ (spacy/tagger.cpp:6245) File "spacy/morphology.pyx", line 76, in spacy.morphology.Morphology.assign_tag_id (spacy/morphology.cpp:4681) KeyError: 139255 </denchmark-code>

52 if Lexeme.c_check_flag(token.lex, IS_SPACE): ---> 53 tag_id = self.reverse_index[self.strings['SP']] 54 analysis = <MorphAnalysisC*>self._cache.get(tag_id, token.lex.orth) 55 if analysis is NULL: KeyError: 119560`
Solved it. I was looking into the wrong tag_map.py I had to add "SP": {POS: SPACE} in the folder of the language Dutch. I hope this is helpful for other people.
